adm:managed-object.name: replication-domain
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
A
comprises of several Directory Servers sharing the same synchronized set of data.

adm:property.name: replication-server
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the addresses of the Replication Servers within the
to which the Directory Server should try to connect at startup time.
adm:property.adm:description: Addresses must be specified using the syntax: hostname:port

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: A host name followed by a ":" and a port number.

adm:property.name: server-id
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies a unique identifier for the Directory Server within the .
adm:property.adm:description:
Each Directory Server within the same
must have a different server ID. A Directory Server which is a member of multiple
may use the same server ID for each of its
configurations.

adm:property.name: base-dn
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the base DN of the replicated data.

adm:property.name: window-size
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the window size that the Directory Server will use when communicating with Replication Servers.

adm:property.name: heartbeat-interval
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the heart-beat interval that the Directory Server will use when communicating with Replication Servers.
adm:property.adm:description: The Directory Server expects a regular heart-beat coming from the Replication Server within the specified interval. If a heartbeat is not received within the interval, the Directory Server closes its connection and connects to another Replication Server.

adm:property.name: isolation-policy
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the behavior of the Directory Server if a write operation is attempted on the data within the
when none of the configured Replication Servers are available.

adm:value.name: accept-all-updates
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Indicates that updates should be accepted even though it is not possible to send them to any Replication Server. Best effort is made to re-send those updates to a Replication Servers when one of them is available, however those changes are at risk because they are only available from the historical information. This mode can also introduce high replication latency.

adm:value.name: reject-all-updates
adm:value.adm:synopsis:
Indicates that all updates attempted on this
are rejected when no Replication Server is available.
